query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
1 In forma dunque di candida rosa 2 mi si mostrava la milizia santa 3 che nel suo sangue Cristo fece sposa;
4 ma l’altra, che volando vede e canta 5 la gloria di colui che la ’nnamora 6 e la bontà che la fece cotanta,
7 sì come schiera d’ape che s’infiora 8 una fïata e una si ritorna 9 là dove suo laboro s’insapora,
10 nel gran fior discendeva che s’addorna 11 di tante foglie, e quindi risaliva 12 là dove ’l süo amor sempre soggiorna.
query.result:
1 In the form of a white rose 2 the holy army showed itself to me 3 that Christ made his bride with his blood;
4 but the other, that flying sees and sings 5 the glory of him who makes her fall in love 6 and the goodness that made her so great,
7 like a swarm of bees that flowers 8 at once and at once returns 9 where its labor is savored,
10 descended into the great flower that adorns itself 11 with so many leaves, and then rose again 12 where its love always dwells.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
13 Le facce tutte avean di fiamma viva 14 e l’ali d’oro, e l’altro tanto bianco, 15 che nulla neve a quel termine arriva.
query.result: 13 Their faces were all of living flame, 14 and their wings of gold, and the rest so white, 15 that no snow reaches that limit.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
16 Quando scendean nel fior, di banco in banco 17 porgevan de la pace e de l’ardore 18 ch’elli acquistavan ventilando il fianco.
query.result: 16 When they descended into the flower, from bench to bench 17 they offered some of the peace and of the ardor 18 that they acquired by fanning their sides.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
19 Né l’interporsi tra ’l disopra e ’l fiore 20 di tanta moltitudine volante 21 impediva la vista e lo splendore:
22 ché la luce divina è penetrante 23 per l’universo secondo ch’è degno, 24 sì che nulla le puote essere ostante.
query.result:
19 Nor did the interposition between the above and the flower 20 of such a flying multitude 21 impede the sight and the splendor:
22 because the divine light is penetrating 23 through the universe according to what is worthy, 24 so that nothing can hinder it.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
25 Questo sicuro e gaudïoso regno, 26 frequente in gente antica e in novella, 27 viso e amore avea tutto ad un segno.
query.result: 25 This secure and joyful kingdom, 26 frequented by people of old and new, 27 had its gaze and love all directed to one point.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
28 O trina luce che ’n unica stella 29 scintillando a lor vista, sì li appaga! 30 guarda qua giuso a la nostra procella!
31 Se i barbari, venendo da tal plaga 32 che ciascun giorno d’Elice si cuopra, 33 rotante col suo figlio ond’ ella è vaga,
34 veggendo Roma e l’ardüa sua opra, 35 stupefaciensi, quando Laterano 36 a le cose mortali andò di sopra;
37 ïo, che al divino da l’umano, 38 a l’etterno dal tempo era venuto, 39 e di Fiorenza in popol giusto e sano,
40 di che stupor dovea esser compiuto! 41 Certo tra esso e ’l gaudio mi facea 42 libito non udire e starmi muto.
query.result:
28 O threefold light that, sparkling in a single star, 29 so satisfies them with your sight! 30 Look down here at our tempest!
31 If the barbarians, coming from such a region 32 that every day is covered by the constellation of the Great Bear, 33 rotating with its son around which it revolves,
34 seeing Rome and its arduous work, 35 were astounded when the Lateran 36 surpassed mortal things;
37 I, who had come to the divine from the human, 38 to the eternal from time, 39 and from Florence to a just and healthy people,
40 with what astonishment should I have been filled! 41 Certainly, between that and the joy, 42 it pleased me not to hear and to remain silent.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
43 E quasi peregrin che si ricrea 44 nel tempio del suo voto riguardando, 45 e spera già ridir com’ ello stea,
46 su per la viva luce passeggiando, 47 menava ïo li occhi per li gradi, 48 mo sù, mo giù e mo recirculando.
query.result:
43 And like a pilgrim who rejoices 44 in the temple of his vow, looking around, 45 and already hopes to tell again how it stands,
46 I, walking through the living light, 47 turned my eyes over the tiers, 48 now up, now down, and now circling back.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
49 Vedëa visi a carità süadi, 50 d’altrui lume fregiati e di suo riso, 51 e atti ornati di tutte onestadi.
query.result: 49 I saw faces sweetened by charity, 50 adorned with the light of others and with their own smiles, 51 and actions adorned with all honesty.

52 The general form of Paradise 53 my gaze had already fully comprehended, 54 not yet fixed intently on any part;
55 and I turned with rekindled desire 56 to ask my lady about things 57 on which my mind was suspended.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
58 Uno intendëa, e altro mi rispuose: 59 credea veder Beatrice e vidi un sene 60 vestito con le genti glorïose.
query.result: 58 I understood one thing, and she answered me with another: 59 I thought to see Beatrice and I saw an elder 60 clothed with the glorious people.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
61 Diffuso era per li occhi e per le gene 62 di benigna letizia, in atto pio 63 quale a tenero padre si convene.
query.result: 61 His eyes and cheeks were suffused 62 with a benign joy, in a pious manner 63 as befits a tender father.

64 And "Where is she?" I said immediately. 65 To which he: "To fulfill your desire, 66 Beatrice moved me from my place;
67 and if you look up in the third circle 68 from the highest tier, you will see her again 69 on the throne that her merits allotted to her."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
70 Sanza risponder, li occhi sù levai, 71 e vidi lei che si facea corona 72 reflettendo da sé li etterni rai.
query.result: 70 Without answering, I raised my eyes, 71 and I saw her who was making a crown for herself 72 by reflecting the eternal rays from herself.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
73 Da quella regïon che più sù tona 74 occhio mortale alcun tanto non dista, 75 qualunque in mare più giù s’abbandona,
76 quanto lì da Beatrice la mia vista; 77 ma nulla mi facea, ché süa effige 78 non discendëa a me per mezzo mista.
query.result:
73 From that region which thunders highest 74 no mortal eye is ever so distant, 75 no matter how far down into the sea one ventures,
76 as my sight was from Beatrice there; 77 but it mattered not to me, for her image 78 did not descend to me mixed through a medium.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
79 «O donna in cui la mia speranza vige, 80 e che soffristi per la mia salute 81 in inferno lasciar le tue vestige,
82 di tante cose quant’ i’ ho vedute, 83 dal tuo podere e da la tua bontate 84 riconosco la grazia e la virtute.
query.result:
79 "O lady in whom my hope thrives, 80 and who suffered to leave your footprints in Hell 81 for my salvation,
82 of all the many things that I have seen, 83 I recognize the grace and the virtue 84 from your power and from your goodness.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
85 Tu m’hai di servo tratto a libertate 86 per tutte quelle vie, per tutt’ i modi 87 che di ciò fare avei la potestate.
query.result: 85 You have led me from servitude to liberty 86 through all those ways, through all those means 87 by which you had the power to do so.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
88 La tua magnificenza in me custodi, 89 sì che l’anima mia, che fatt’ hai sana, 90 piacente a te dal corpo si disnodi».
query.result: 88 Preserve your magnificence in me, 89 so that my soul, which you have made whole, 90 may be untied from the body pleasing to you.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
91 Così orai; e quella, sì lontana 92 come parea, sorrise e riguardommi; 93 poi si tornò a l’etterna fontana.

Please translate literally into English.
94 E ’l santo sene: «Acciò che tu assommi 95 perfettamente», disse, «il tuo cammino, 96 a che priego e amor santo mandommi,
97 vola con li occhi per questo giardino; 98 ché veder lui t’acconcerà lo sguardo 99 più al montar per lo raggio divino.
query.result:
94 And the holy elder said, "In order that you may perfectly 95 complete your journey, 96 for which a holy prayer and love sent me to you,
97 fly with your eyes through this garden; 98 for seeing it will prepare your sight 99 more for ascending through the divine radiance.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
100 E la regina del cielo, ond’ ïo ardo 101 tutto d’amor, ne farà ogne grazia, 102 però ch’i’ sono il suo fedel Bernardo».
query.result: 100 And the queen of heaven, for whom I burn 101 all with love, will grant us every grace, 102 because I am her faithful Bernard."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
103 Qual è colui che forse di Croazia 104 viene a veder la Veronica nostra, 105 che per l’antica fame non sen sazia,
106 ma dice nel pensier, fin che si mostra: 107 ‘Segnor mio Iesù Cristo, Dio verace, 108 or fu sì fatta la sembianza vostra?’;
109 tal era io mirando la vivace 110 carità di colui che ’n questo mondo, 111 contemplando, gustò di quella pace.
query.result:
103 Like one who perhaps comes from Croatia 104 to see our Veronica, 105 who is not sated by the ancient hunger,
106 but says in his thoughts, as long as it is shown: 107 'My Lord Jesus Christ, true God, 108 was your likeness really like this?'
109 Such was I, gazing at the living 110 charity of him who, contemplating in this world, 111 tasted of that peace.

112 "Son of grace, this joyful existence," 113 he began, "will not be known to you, 114 if you keep your eyes fixed down here on the bottom;
115 but look up to the farthest circles, 116 until you see the queen seated 117 to whom this kingdom is subject and devoted."

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
118 Io levai li occhi; e come da mattina 119 la parte orïental de l’orizzonte 120 soverchia quella dove ’l sol declina,
121 così, quasi di valle andando a monte 122 con li occhi, vidi parte ne lo stremo 123 vincer di lume tutta l’altra fronte.
query.result:
118 I raised my eyes; and as in the morning 119 the eastern part of the horizon 120 surpasses the part where the sun declines,
121 so, as if going from a valley to a mountain 122 with my eyes, I saw a part at the extremity 123 surpassing all the other expanse with light.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
124 E come quivi ove s’aspetta il temo 125 che mal guidò Fetonte, più s’infiamma, 126 e quinci e quindi il lume si fa scemo,
127 così quella pacifica oriafiamma 128 nel mezzo s’avvivava, e d’ogne parte 129 per igual modo allentava la fiamma;
130 e a quel mezzo, con le penne sparte, 131 vid’ io più di mille angeli festanti, 132 ciascun distinto di fulgore e d’arte.

query.result:
133 There, in their games and songs, 134 I saw a beauty smiling, which was joy 135 in the eyes of all the other saints;
136 and if I had as much wealth in words 137 as I have in imagination, I would not dare 138 to attempt the least bit of her delight.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
139 Bernardo, come vide li occhi miei 140 nel caldo suo caler fissi e attenti, 141 li suoi con tanto affetto volse a lei,
142 che ’ miei di rimirar fé più ardenti.
query.result:
139 Bernard, when he saw my eyes 140 fixed and intent on his warm descent, 141 turned his own to her with such affection,
142 that it made mine more ardent to behold her.
